Another thing I would erase is poverty. Poverty is a major issue that affects millions of people around the world, and it can have a profound impact on a person's quality of life. Erasing discrimination would mean that everyone would be treated equally, regardless of their race, gender, religion, or sexual orientation.

Erasing disease would mean that people would be able to live healthy, fulfilling lives free from the fear of illness and the constraints of medical treatment.

Erasing natural disasters would mean that people would be protected from the devastating effects of these events, and would be able to live in a world where they are no longer a threat.

Erasing inequality would mean that everyone would have access to the same opportunities and resources, and would be able to live a life free from the constraints of social and economic disadvantage.
